data.title: More like 4th Street Racist Pizza company
data.text: Really Bad service, actually service depends on your race. The bouncer was very rude and a racist allowing only guys and girls of his race entering first, despite us standing in the line for almost 30 mins seeing him allow other people of his race entering first, cutting through the line. Never been to a place with so much racial discrimination. When interjected the bouncer even told us that he was taking them in because they were his people. What's the use of standing in a line when people are given service according to their race? Pathetic would never come back to this place.

data.title: Game, Beer and Fun
data.text: I lived in San Jose for 2 years and this place was so fun to start the evening. We always went there to grab slices of pizza, a few beers and enjoy the games on the TVs. Good fun overall !

data.title: Slow service
data.text: Lots of tv, good atmosphere but took more than 20 min to order a beer. Food was so so.  They definitely need more waiters

data.title: Great place
data.text: A group of us went to 4th street pizza for some food, beverages and dessert. The mozzarella sticks, hot chicken wings and chocolate chip cookie with ice cream for dessert was all very tasty. The beer's could have been a bit colder (I love my beer ice cold) and the glasses had just been washed so they weren't chilled either. Overall it was a good time, great company and the atmosphere was sporty.

data.title: Best Pizza in San Jose
data.text: OK, I'm from New York, so I'm a pizza snob.  It took me years to find good pizza in California, and with the exception of Mama Mias, I think this is the best pizza in California.  The crust is the best combo...a little puffy, and a little crispy.  Not too thick, not too thin.  Yummy sauces, and toppings are...well toppings.  Whatever you like.    The restaurant itself is fun and sports bar-ish, with a fresh salad bar daily, and a full huge bar with several screen to watch the game with friends.    Always quick and clean and friendly.

data.title: Best sports bar!
data.text: 4th Street Pizza is more like a huge sports bar. So many TVs we often watch games here. And, pizza by the slice is convenient. They have a great salad bar too. Service is ok most of the time.

data.title: Can be better with a few gourmet twist in their menu
data.text: Awful!  Nachos!  Stale chips, guacamole was not avocado basically infused with hydrogenated oil. For $9.99..they should at least used real avocadoes. Considering it is cheap to include 80% chips..Pizzas were salty..but loaded with meat might be a plus for meat eaters...the food quality can be better...not my choice for a good pizza dinner.

data.title: Good pizza & atmosphere
data.text: Great place for a sports bar, go mingle, watch a game or 2, eat some salad, pizza, beer and enjoy your friends.

data.title: Power Hour
data.text:
11-12am

Great deals on drinks! Show up early!

Better than a happy hour, they give ridiculous discounts for one hour on Thursdays - Saturday nights, some kind of crazy deal like 50% off shots or something.

data.title: No chilled white wine, server taking shots
data.text: This is a hot spot for my clients since it is right across the street from where they work, but I was NOT impressed. I got there before them since they had a few things to do at their desks before coming over, so I asked what kind of white wine they had. She had Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc...so I asked for the Sauvignon Blanc. She bumbled around behind the bar for a minute and then said she would have to retrieve it from the back. Okay...however when she returned she said well it's not in the refrigerator so it will be warm. So obviously I did not want it. I asked about her Tequila since I cannot drink beer/whisky due to gluten-related health issues. She had a very few choices but I found one that was 'okay'. I found it odd that it was served in a plastic cup...Tequila neat in a plastic cup??? Odd? Once my clients got there they started ordering shots and while I took the drink, I sipped mine because that's how I roll...but what struck me as odd is that she would fill theirs about 2/3rd full and mine about 1/3rd full (of the plastic Tequila neat plastic cup) AND weirder than that, she joined them in taking the shots. So apparently it is perfectly fine for bartenders at this establishment to get drunk while working. That does not impress me. There was also not one thing on their menu that I could eat, but that's because of my health issues. Next time, I will use that as an excuse to get out of going there again. I am certain that there are fabulous casual bars in SJ, but I was not introduced to them for sure!

data.title: Pleasant surprise!!
data.text: We had a work session in downtown San Jose and needed a pizza break. One of my colleagues suggested 4th Street Pizza.  When we went to pick up the order, everything was ready, and the gal at the cash register was extremely pleasant and efficient.  The pizzas were delicious, too!  Made my volunteers very happy, and we all know how important it is!!  :)

data.title: Good pizza joint
data.text: Really nice pizza palor w/ lots of tv for a game. Sales bar somewhat ok. Bar area is nice and stocked. Pizza is pretty good.

data.title: Good Pizza
data.text: We went here only because of a great deal from GROUPON. But it turns out the pizzas were good. The hot wings were good too. There were plenty of places to sit and lots of flat screen TVs to watch from. Service was excellent. Cannot say anything about the alcohol since were did not drink. But I notice that they have an excellent deal everyday. Parking was limited since it was downtown. We ordered the 4th street special and garlic chicken (half and half). This place is not appropriate to take little children.

data.title: The food was great!
data.text: Excellent Pizza. Poor service. I stopped in for a quick slice and drink after a long hard day and had to wait 15 minutes just to have the waitress take my drink order and give me a menu. Then I had to wait 15 more minutes to order. It was not busy, but there was only one waitress and she was in the back kitchen the whole time. However the food made it worth the wait. The pizza was excellent and the flat panel TVs on the walls mad the time go by quicker.
